title: Drawing, "Design for a Window Wall with Tapestry Panel, Chateau de Craon", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, rose and yellow watercolor, black chalk on cream paper
signed: Signed in black ink at lower right corner: Marechal an 1780.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper margin: Vis a vis des Croisee du Grand Salon de Craon, Pour Etre Execute an tapisserie de Bauvais. Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower margin: Cette Echelle et a pouce pour pied, 6 pied; indication of scale located at lower center. Inscribed in a later hand at lower left: Br. J. Pichon no. 13.
provenance: Baron Jerome Pichon (sales, Paris, 10-15 May 1897,cat.no. 96); Leon Decloux,Sevres, France.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A design for a wall.  The central panel (tapestry) features three Fates spinning the thread of life.  Above them, a putto holds a crowned monogram, which may contain the initials of the Chateau de Craon's owner, the Marquis d'Armaille. This decorative central panel is flanked by two draped windows, through which can be seen a romantic landscape with classical temples. Beneath the windows are circular medallions with lyres and torches. Below the tapestry and on the window frames are located carved ornaments.
